author: Miranda Larbi
title: This cancer survivor has been collecting ‘Bald Buddies’ to try and normalise being bald
text:
(Picture: Reddit/Nathan634) Losing your hair can be one of the most traumatic elements of undergoing cancer treatment.
On top of feeling awful, you no longer look like yourself.
Why do people care that women of different sizes are friends? Many women, of course, opt to wear scarves and wigs. But even then, they can be uncomfortable, ill-fitting, expensive and itchy.
The most comfortable thing to do is just to go au natural – but that can be scary.
Which is why one survivor is trying to help normalise baldness in the hope of empowering others to feel better about their chemo-related hair loss.
Imgur user nathan634 says that since his mum was diagnosed with cancer last November, she’s been undergoing chemotherapy and ‘has decided to try and normalise being bald bald by approaching bald strangers and friends and asking for a photo’.
‘She calls the collection “Bald Buddies”.’
She’s asked all sorts of people to take a selfie with her:
From random DPD delivery men ‘The first stranger she had the courage to ask’ (Picture: Reddit/Nathan634) To strangers at airports (Picture: Reddit/Nathan634) She’s snapped members of her church congregation (Picture: Reddit/Nathan634) Lead trombonists in the BBC Philharmonic orchestra (Picture: Reddit/Nathan634) German ice cream parlour owners (Picture: Reddit/Nathan634) And even a mate’s builder (Picture: Reddit/Nathan634) All to prove that baldness isn’t something to be afraid of…just like asking for selfies with randomers.
